intro: Pentagonia sanblasensis, commonly known as the San Blas pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of San Blas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pentagonal-shaped leaves, which give it its scientific name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Pentagonia sanblasensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
